body: i got similar issue, resolved using https://gist.github.com/akhgupta/fddaad12bb0346624a8b7801467e1b42
@akhgupta I already add method isInAnalyzerProcess in leakcanary-android-no-op by myself.

This is just because the no-op version of the library [doesn't have isInAnalyzerProcess()](https://github.com/square/leakcanary/blob/master/leakcanary-android-no-op/src/main/java/com/squareup/leakcanary/LeakCanary.java), right?

body: Is there a work-around for this issue aside from running the 1.5 snapshots? Thanks!
`1.5` will be released soon. In the meantime, the work around would be to have a DebugApplication and move the LeakCanary init code there.
What about refwatcher if we initialize in debug application? Should we move `LeakCanary.install()` to debug as well
